p:
Pimodivir is a cyclohexyl carboxylic acid analogue ( Fig 1) that inhibits influenza virus replication by targeting the polymerase PB2 subunit. The drug outperformed current standard-of-care in animal infection models of H3N2 and H1N1 viruses, although potency was highest against H1N1 strains.
116 Also pimodivir remained active against viruses harboring signature resistance mutations to the NAIs,
117 and is presumably at low risk of cross-resistance with baloxavir marboxil as well. The compound was well-tolerated in a phase 2 clinical trial, reduced viral load, and resulted in slightly faster resolve of clinical signs.
